string-array.name: Koko_Head_Milestone
string-array.item: This hike is a relatively straightforward as you will be climbing up railroad tracks. However this hike requires good physical condition as the heat and 1000 steps make this tough. The uneven terrain also can prove to be challenging so be sure to wear proper gear. \n\n Please be aware of any posted signage and read warnings carefully.
Simply hike up the stairs until you reach the outpost at the top. Please be mindful of others climbing down the steps. To get back, walk back down the steps to the start of the trail.

string-array.name: Manoa_Falls_Milestone
string-array.item: The gate to the trail will be near the message board. \n\n Your start and return point will be here so backtracking will be needed. Take care to observe the posted messages and familiarize yourself with the signage.
The second area to look for is in the wooden planks. This crosses over a stream. \n\n Continue to follow the worn path to avoid injuries and erosion to other areas of the trail.

There will be an opening in the canopy with two paths. There are multiple ways to continue up but be sure to account for the mud here. The incline becomes very steep and may prove difficult on rainy days. \n\n Walk until you reach the stone walls

You should reach an area with many roots coming out of the ground. In addition there will be plastic footings here to help with grip. The terrain after this point becomes muddier and elevates. \n\n Continue on until you reach a large opening
Approach these stairs with caution and be mindful of others. There are no handrails and can be slippery if damp. \n\n Continue on until you see the waterfall

string-array.name: Makapuu_Lighthouse_Milestone
string-array.item: The entrance for this trail is marked clearly by some bollards after the end of the parking lot. Take care to read the posted signage and understand the safety warnings. \n\n There will be a smooth asphalt walkway that curves up to the 2nd milestone. Since the path is very clearly marked, do not go off the white lines to avoid eroding surroundings.

The second milestone will have the lighthouse visibly around the corner. As you walk up there will be a fork in the road. Walk to the right to get to a vantage point. otherwise take the left or turn around to get to the start. \n\n Continue until you reach the edge of the lookout
The lighthouse will be below the cliff. Take the time to rest here. \n\n Backtrack to the start of the trail on the same path taken earlier.

resources.string-array:
The start of the Lanikai ridge trail is marked with a manmade sign and is between 2 areas of private property, the trail quickly gets steep as you ascend the mountain ridge!
The ridge is easy to follow without any confusing paths, keep following it until you reach the first pillbox.
Continue along the ridge until you reach the next pillbox.
The final pillbox is much smaller and eroded but marks the end of the hike.>

string-array.name: Maunawili_Falls_Milestone
string-array.item: The start of the Maunawili trail is marked by handmade posted sign with a clear path, follow this path for the first 2 miles.
You\'ll come to a bend in the path with staircases going to the left, descend these stairs to get to the river floor.
Once at the bottom of the valley follow the river upstream until you get to the waterfall.

string-array.name: Stairway_to_Heaven_Milestone
string-array.item: The legal route to the Stairway to Heaven starts with the Moanalua valley trail, marked by a state hike marker and green vehicle gate.
The Moanalua valley trail is a scenic forest semi-paved trail with 17 small bridge and water passings, be careful during rainy seasons as these passings may be flooded.
At the end of the Moanalua trail there will be a state marked sign, turn left at the sign and follow the small uphill path. This will start to take you up the mountain ridge.
Continue hiking up the steep mountain range until you reach the very top, certain sections of the ridge are very steep and have rope railings you can use to climb up.

Once you reach the satellite tower you will be at the top of the Stairway to Heaven. You can climb down these stairs partway for pictures but do not descend all the way as this will take you to the illegal entrance. You must go back the way you came.
